<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But, save that self 
            <choice>
              <sic>oncsiousnes</sic>
              <corr>consciousness</corr>
            </choice> has not yet raised</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">its mirror, it is not a childs world. The men and women are</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">corrupt already in this fresh world. They have evil dreams.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#kart" key="Arthur (King)">Arthur</rs> is doomed. 
            <choice>
              <sic> reat ki gs</sic>
              <corr>Great kings</corr>
            </choice> are undone by their own vices.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">The 
            <choice>
              <sic>Quuens</sic>
              <corr>Queens</corr>
            </choice> are lustful. Still we can 
            <choice>
              <sic>revsit</sic>
              <corr>revisit</corr>
            </choice> their world.</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">But of the 
            <choice>
              <sic>wr ter</sic>
              <corr>writer</corr>
            </choice> nothing is known. <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-tmal" key="Malory, Thomas">Malory</rs> is not distinct</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">from his book. It is still the voice of <rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-anon" key="Anon">anon</rs>, speaking to</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the voice of anon. The dream is still dreamt. <quote source="#">"...folks</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">do say"</quote> a 
            <choice>
              <sic>peasnt</sic>
              <corr>peasant</corr>
            </choice> at <rs type="place" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#pla-cadb" key="Cadbury">Cadbury</rs> said in the 
            <choice>
              <sic>ninenenth</sic>
              <corr>nineteenth</corr>
            </choice> century,</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">"that on the night of the full moon King Arthur and his men</quote></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><quote source="#" rend="inline">ride round the hill, and their horses are shod with silver..."</quote></l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0"><rs type="person" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#psn-wcax">Caxton</rs>, printing the <rs type="literary-work" ref="../resources/annotations.xml#lit-mort" key="Morte d'Arthur">Morte Darthur</rs> at the

              <corr>solicitation</corr>
            </choice></l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">of the nobles and the gentry, had his doubts. Anon wxxxx</l>

              <sic>existsed</sic>
              <corr>existed</corr>
            </choice> but a shade has fallen 
            <choice>
              <sic>upo</sic>
              <corr>upon</corr>
            </choice> him. The printed</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">book with its writers name attached to was destined to kill</l>
<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">him. After that, the audience became separate from</l>

<l xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0">the singer. And the 
            <choice>
              <sic>audeince</sic>
              <corr>audience</corr>
            </choice> no longer took part in the song</l>
